Description: Faience scarab; pierced longitudinally; engraved elytra, head and legs and on the base the name of Queen Tiy, wife of Amenhotep III; poorly preserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 251)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 47)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.21,36, Pl IV)
